p: The E. pavieana was cultivated in a commercial local farm in the Trad province, Thailand. The plant was collected and identified by an expert herbalist. The whole plant of E. pavieana was harvested in August 2015. The fresh rhizomes of E. pavieana were washed to remove soil and chopped into small pieces. The chopped rhizomes (100 kg) were fed into a vertical hydrodistillation machine (HVAC Engineering Co. Ltd., Pathumthani, Thailand) for 10 h. The essential oil was stored at −30 °C in an airtight container for further use. The total amount of essential oil was recorded. The yield percentage was calculated on a fresh weight basis.
